Detailed Description

Contains ray tracing routines optimized for different input/output formats.

Notice that the OPDs are accumulated.

Define Documentation

#define EPS

A threashold.

#define ONLY_FULL

set to 1 to be compatible with other props.

#define MAKE_CUBIC_PARAM

For cubic interpolation.

Function Documentation

void prop ( thread_t *  data  ) 

A wrapper prop routine that handles all the different cases by calling the different routines.

Handles threading.

void prop_grid_grid ( const map_t *  mapin,
map_t *  mapout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
int  wrap 
)

Propagate OPD defines on grid mapin to grid mapout.

alpha is the scaling of data. displacex, displacy is the displacement of the center of the beam on the input grid. scale is the cone effect.

Parameters:
[in] mapin OPD defind on a square grid
[in,out] mapout OPD defind on a square grid
[in] alpha scaling of OPD
[in] displacex displacement of the ray
[in] displacey displacement of the ray
[in] scale scaling of the beam diameter (cone)
[in] wrap wrap input OPD or not

void prop_grid_pts ( const map_t *  mapin,
const pts_t *  pts,
double *  phiout0,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
int  wrap,
long  sastart,
long  saend,
int  optim 
)

Propagate OPD defines on grid mapin to subapertures.

alpha is the scaling of data. displacex, displacy is the displacement of the center of the beam on the input grid. scale is the cone effect.

Parameters:
[in] mapin OPD defind on a square grid
[in] pts defining each subaperture
[in,out] phiout0 OPDs for each subaperture
[in] alpha scaling of OPD
[in] displacex displacement of the beam
[in] displacey displacement of the beam
[in] scale scaling of the beam diameter (cone)
[in] wrap wrap input OPD or not
[in] sastart The starting subaperture to trace ray
[in] saend The last (exclusive) subaperture to trace ray
[in] optim Use the optimized procedure (for testing)

void prop_grid_stat ( const map_t *  mapin,
const locstat_t *  ostat,
double *  phiout0,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
int  wrap,
long  colstart,
long  colend,
int  optim 
)

Propagate OPD defines on grid mapin to locstat_t that stores the starting point of each column.

alpha is the scaling of data. displacex, displacy is the displacement of the center of the beam on the input grid. scale is the cone effect.

Parameters:
[in] mapin OPD defind on a square grid
[in] ostat information about each clumn of a output loc grid
[in,out] phiout0 OPD defined on ostat
[in] alpha scaling of OPD
[in] displacex displacement of the ray
[in] displacey displacement of the ray
[in] scale scaling of the beam diameter (cone)
[in] wrap wrap input OPD or not
[in] colstart First column to do ray tracing
[in] colend Last column (exclusive) to do ray tracing
[in] optim Use the optimized procedure (for testing)

void prop_grid ( const map_t *  mapin,
const loc_t *  locout,
double *  phiout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
int  wrap,
long  start,
long  end 
)

Propagate OPD defines on grid mapin to coordinate locout.

alpha is the scaling of data. displacex, displacy is the displacement of the center of the beam on the input grid. scale is the cone effect.

Parameters:
[in] mapin OPD defind on a square grid
[in] locout coordinate of irregular destination grid
[in,out] phiout OPD defined on locout
[in] alpha scaling of OPD
[in] displacex displacement of the ray
[in] displacey displacement of the ray
[in] scale wrap input OPD or not
[in] wrap wrap input OPD or not
[in] start First point to do
[in] end Last point to do

void prop_nongrid ( loc_t *  locin,
const double *  phiin,
const loc_t *  locout,
const double *  ampout,
double *  phiout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
long  start,
long  end 
)

Propagate OPD defines on coordinate locin to coordinate locout.

This is the slowest. alpha is the scaling of data. displacex, displacy is the displacement of the center of the beam on the input grid. scale is the cone effect. See prop_grid() for definition of other parameters.

Parameters:
[in] locin Coordinate of iregular source grid
[in] phiin Input OPD defined in locin
[in] locout Coordinate of irregular output grid
[in] ampout Amplitude defined on locout. skip point of amp is 0
[in,out] phiout Output OPD defined in locout
[in] alpha scaling of OPD
[in] displacex displacement of the ray
[in] displacey displacement of the ray
[in] scale wrap input OPD or not
[in] start First point to do
[in] end Last point to do

void prop_nongrid_map ( loc_t *  locin,
const double *  phiin,
map_t *  mapout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
long  start,
long  end,
long  step 
)

Propagate OPD defines on coordinate locin to grid mapout.

alpha is the scaling of data. displacex, displacy is the displacement of the center of the beam on the input grid. scale is the cone effect.

Parameters:
[in] locin Coordinate of iregular source grid
[in] phiin Input OPD defined in locin
[in,out] mapout Output OPD defined in a square grid
[in] alpha scaling of OPD
[in] displacex displacement of the ray
[in] displacey displacement of the ray
[in] scale wrap input OPD or not
[in] start First point to do
[in] end Last point to do
[in] step stride, do tracing every step points.

void prop_nongrid_pts ( loc_t *  locin,
const double *  phiin,
const pts_t *  pts,
const double *  ampout,
double *  phiout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
long  start,
long  end,
long  step 
)

Propagate OPD defines on coordinate locin to subapertures pts.

alpha is the scaling of data. displacex, displacy is the displacement of the center of the beam on the input grid. scale is the cone effect. See prop_groid().

Parameters:
[in] locin Coordinate of iregular source grid
[in] phiin Input OPD defined in locin
[in] pts defining each subaperture
[in] ampout Amplitude of subaps. skip point of amp is 0
[in,out] phiout OPD for subaps
[in] alpha scaling of OPD
[in] displacex displacement of the ray
[in] displacey displacement of the ray
[in] scale wrap input OPD or not
[in] start First point to do
[in] end Last point to do
[in] step stride, do tracing every step points.

void prop_nongrid_cubic ( loc_t *  locin,
const double *  phiin,
const loc_t *  locout,
const double *  ampout,
double *  phiout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
double  cubic_iac,
long  start,
long  end 
)

like prop_nongrid() but with cubic influence functions.

cubic_iac is the inter-actuator coupling.

void prop_nongrid_pts_cubic ( loc_t *  locin,
const double *  phiin,
const pts_t *  pts,
const double *  ampout,
double *  phiout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
double  cubic_iac,
long  start,
long  end,
long  step 
)

like prop_nongrid_pts() but with cubic influence functions.

cubic_iac is the inter-actuator-coupling.

void prop_nongrid_map_cubic ( loc_t *  locin,
const double *  phiin,
map_t *  mapout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale,
double  cubic_iac,
long  start,
long  end,
long  step 
)

like prop_nongrid_map() but with cubic influence functions.

cubic_iac is the inter-actuator-coupling.

void prop_nongrid_reverse ( loc_t *  locin,
double *  phiin,
const loc_t *  locout,
const double *  ampout,
const double *  phiout,
double  alpha,
double  displacex,
double  displacey,
double  scale 
)

the following routine is used to do down sampling by doing *reverse* ray tracing.

locin is coarse sampling, locout is fine sampling. phiin is the destination OPD. The weightings are obtained by interpolating from locin to locout, but the OPD are reversed computed
